columns.name: RATE_GEO_COST_GROUP_GID
columns.description: The GID for the rate cost group. Rate cost groups provide the ability to group separate costs together to produce a final rate.

columns.name: RATE_GEO_COST_GROUP_XID
columns.description: The XID for the rate cost group.

columns.name: RATE_GEO_GID
columns.description: The GID for the rate record related to the group.

columns.name: RATE_GEO_COST_GROUP_SEQ
columns.description: The sequence number used in the UI to display rate groups in order.

columns.name: GROUP_NAME
columns.description: The name used to identify the rate group.

columns.name: DEFICIT_CALCULATIONS_TYPE
columns.description: Defines the way the rating logic handles unit breaks. When there is a unit break defined for a rate, deficit calculations will make sure that the least expensive rate is selected. For example, if a rate break occurs at 1000 pounds, and an order weighs 999 pounds (with a rate of $15 per pound), then the system will look at the price of shipping at the next highest weight break (1001 pounds at $13 per pound) and apply the cheapest rate. In this example, the least expensive option is to use the 1001 pound rate even though only 999 pounds are being shipped. For details on the types, see rounding and deficit calculations.

columns.name: MULTI_RATES_RULE
columns.description: Determine how costs within this group will be calculated.

columns.name: RATE_GROUP_TYPE
columns.description: Set to Base to create a base cost or miscellaneous for all other cost types.

columns.name: ROUNDING_TYPE
columns.description: Dictates how numbers are rounded. Select Ceiling to always round up, Floor to always round down, Nearest Interval to round up if it is 5 or greater and down if it is less than 5, or No Rounding to not round at all.

columns.name: ROUNDING_INTERVAL
columns.description: Specifies what interval to round up or down to. For example, if you want to round up or down to the nearest 1, then you would enter 1 here. If you want to round up or down to the nearest tenth decimal place, then you would enter .1 here.

columns.name: ROUNDING_FIELDS_LEVEL
columns.description: Specifies which fields in the rating process should be rounded. For example, you may only want currency fields rounded.

columns.name: ROUNDING_APPLICATION
columns.description: Defines when rounding should take place. For example, you may only want rounding to be done on cost calculations.

columns.name: DOMAIN_NAME
columns.description: Database domain where this data is stored.

columns.name: INSERT_USER
columns.description: The user ID of the data insert user.

columns.name: INSERT_DATE
columns.description: Date and time of data insert.

columns.name: UPDATE_USER
columns.description: The user ID of the data update user.

columns.name: UPDATE_DATE
columns.description: Date and time of the most recent data update.
